content.raw: Merged, thank you.
`_GAZEBO_` prefix
We're using `_GAZEBO_GUI_` in all classes under `gui`.
Oh I see. How about classes in the editors? I was changing to `_GAZEBO_BUILDING_` but maybe it should be `_GAZEBO_GUI_BUILDING`?
content.html: Oh I see. How about classes in the editors? I was changing to _GAZEBO_BUILDING_ but maybe it should be _GAZEBO_GUI_BUILDING?

content.raw: A potential convention might be `_GAZEBO_<NS_1>_<NS_N>_CLASSNAME_HH_`. E.g.: `_GAZEBO_GUI_BUILDINGEDITOR_HH_`.

So the [`gui/building/GridLines`](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2032/pimplize-gui-building-gridlines/diff#Lgazebo/gui/building/GridLines.hhT18) class for example would look like `_GAZEBO_GUI_BUILDING_GRID_LINES_HH_`, right? Looks good to me.
content.html: So the gui/building/GridLines class for example would look like _GAZEBO_GUI_BUILDING_GRID_LINES_HH_, right? Looks good to me.

content.raw: I'd say `_GAZEBO_GUI_GRIDLINES_HH_` and `_GAZEBO_GUI_GRIDLINES_PRIVATE_HH_`. The only namespaces in that class are `gazebo::gui`. I've been following my proposal but there's nothing wrong with your alternative either.
content.html: I'd say _GAZEBO_GUI_GRIDLINES_HH_ and _GAZEBO_GUI_GRIDLINES_PRIVATE_HH_. The only namespaces in that class are gazebo::gui. I've been following my proposal but there's nothing wrong with your alternative either.

content.raw: Ok, I think it makes sense to follow the namespace. I'll remove the `_BUILDING_`
content.html: Ok, I think it makes sense to follow the namespace. I'll remove the _BUILDING_

content.raw: I see there's ign-math being used in this class, and there are methods starting with `Get`.
